titles: A short, legal, medicinal, useful, safe, easie prescription to recover our kingdom, church, nation from their present dangerous, distractive, destructive confusion and worse than Bedlam madnesse seriously recommended to all English freemen who desire peace, safety, liberty, settlement. By William Prynne, Esq; a bencher of Lincolns-Inne.
author: Prynne, William, 1600-1669.
date: printed in the year of General Monck's invasion, 1659.
notes: Caption title on p. 3 reads: A short, legal, medicinal, useful, safe, easy, prescription, &c.
Copy imperfect; leaves mutilated at head with loss of pagination.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library, Oxford.
keywords: Catholic Church --  Controversial literature --  Early works to 1800.
Religion and politics --  England --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  History --  Puritan Revolution, 1642-1660 --  Early works to 1800.
